translation.en: [narrator] In 39 A.D.,
Caligula is one of the most powerful men in the world.
But he will come to be known
as Rome's mad emperor.
[narrator] In just over a century, the Roman Empire has doubled in size.
translation.ko: 약 1세기에 걸쳐 로마 제국의 영토는 2배로 늘었습니다

translation.en: Now stretching nearly two million square miles
from the Atlantic Ocean to Egypt.
The city of Rome is rapidly expanding,
[Tom Holland] Rome was an enormous city,
even by the standards of today.
And there was a sense in which
translation.ko: 그렇게 된 데에는 "톰 홀랜드, 저자 루비콘: 로마공화국의 최후"

translation.en: infrastructure had been key to its growth, right from the very beginning.
translation.ko: 초기 기반 시설의 확충이 주요했다고 생각됩니다

translation.en: And the engineering feat was
indeed formidable.
[narrator] Roadways now connect Rome to places like Northern Africa,
modern-day France, and Spain.
And advancements in design, like aqueducts...
sewer systems...
and amphitheaters...
have turned Rome into one of the most advanced civilizations on the planet.
translation.ko: 로마는 지구상 가장 진보한 문명으로 우뚝 섭니다

translation.en: [Mike Duncan] Rome was as powerful as it had ever been,
translation.ko: 당시 로마는 역대 최고로 강력했고 "마이크 덩컨 '폭풍 전 폭풍' 저자"

translation.en: and was continuing to grow in power.
translation.ko: "마이크 덩컨 '폭풍 전 폭풍' 저자" 그 힘이 날로 커갔어요

translation.en: They were at the zenith of their power.
So... when it came to its position
relative to other foreign powers, Rome was the biggest power in the world.
translation.ko: 다른 외세와 견줄 때 로마가 세계 최강이었어요

translation.en: [narrator] Rome's rise to global dominance
is in part thanks to its powerful military,
made up of nearly 300,000 soldiers.
The Roman military dominated the Western world.
There was nothing to match the Roman military.
[narrator] The Roman army has been waging a war against barbarians in Germania,
translation.ko: 당시 로마군은 게르마니아와 전쟁을 치르고 있었습니다

translation.en: hoping to keep their borders secure.
Rome has spent years and years fighting on the German frontier,
translation.ko: 로마는 오랫동안 게르만족과 싸웠어요 "앤서니 에버리트 '로마의 부흥' 저자"

translation.en: to ensure that the German tribes were not able to come and march into Gaul
translation.ko: 게르만족이 국경을 넘어 갈리아나 제국 안쪽으로

translation.en: or into other parts of the Empire.
So it's a very big operation.
[man] Here, take this.
Hold it high and strong.
Feet apart.
[narrator] On the sidelines of the battlefield...
...a young Caligula is growing up.
For the first years of his life,
Caligula was pretty much on the road,
going from military camp to military camp.
His playground was, effectively, the most violent arena of war.
translation.ko: 그의 놀이터는 사실상 가장 잔혹한 전쟁터였어요

translation.en: Caligula is brought up in a household of great privilege, great expectations.
translation.ko: 칼리굴라의 집안은 막대한 특권과 가능성을 누렸죠 "배리 슈트라우스 '카이사르의 죽음' 저자"

translation.en: Because he was the son of a great general.
And not only was his father a great general,
translation.ko: 그의 아버지는 장군이자 명예로운 분인 데다

translation.en: a man of honor, but he was the nephew of the ruling emperor of Rome.
translation.ko: 그의 아버지는 장군이자 명예로운 분인 데다 당시 로마를 지배한 황제의 조카이기도 했어요

translation.en: [narrator] Caligula's father is the most beloved leader in the Roman army,
translation.ko: 칼리굴라의 부친은 로마군에서 제일 존경받는 지도자이자

translation.en: and next in line to become emperor of Rome.
His name is Germanicus.
[Germanicus] How many men to a cohort?
Four hundred and eighty.
How many to a legion?
One thousand.
Five thousand.
Led by?
Six tribunes...
[Amanda Ruggeri] Germanicus was a blue-blooded Roman prince.
The guy was handsome, he was charming,
he was well-educated.
[Amanda Ruggeri] He was, at the time, the most respected general in Rome.
translation.ko: 게르마니쿠스는 당시 로마에서 가장 존경받는 사령관이었고

translation.en: So Caligula as a child would have been growing up
as the son of this incredibly popular guy,
and he is traveling around with his father
all throughout his young childhood.
Are you tired, or should we move onto weapons?
Weapons.
-Javelins are made of... -Wood and iron.
-Short swords? -Steel.
[narrator] Germanicus trains Caligula to be a great warrior,
forming a close bond between father and son,
but that's all about to change.
While Germanicus protects Rome's borders,
nearly a thousand miles away,
the reigning emperor, Tiberius, works to protect his legacy.
translation.ko: 티베리우스 황제가 자기 유산을 지키고자 합니다

translation.en: Tiberius was not a natural politician.
Anything but.
He was charmless in many ways,
he had many enemies,
he clashed with the Senate.
He ended up leading the trial and execution of numerous senators.
translation.ko: 여러 원로를 재판에 부쳐 처형하기까지 했어요

translation.en: Under Tiberius, Rome underwent a reign of terror.
[narrator] Tiberius is only the second emperor Rome has ever had,
translation.ko: 티베리우스는 이제 겨우 로마의 제2대 황제이나

translation.en: but he spends much of his reign in the shadow of his predecessor.
[Adrian Murdoch] The previous emperor, Augustus, was the greatest emperor that Rome ever had.
translation.ko: 선황 아우구스투스는 로마 사상 최고의 황제였어요

translation.en: He managed to do the impossible.
He brought Rome together,
he brought the provinces together,
but on the other hand, the emperor Tiberius was the emperor of austerity.
There was none of the glamour of Augustus,
he didn't want to push the Empire forward.
[narrator] Caligula's father, Germanicus,
may be next in line to be emperor of Rome...
...but Tiberius wants to pass on the throne to his son.
translation.ko: 티베리우스는 자기 아들에게 제위를 물려주고자 합니다

translation.en: So he makes a move to take out Germanicus.
[soldier] Guards!
[soldier 1] Don't touch him.
[soldier 2] What happened?
[narrator] Caligula is only seven years old when his father dies suddenly,
translation.ko: 칼리굴라가 겨우 7살 때 게르마니쿠스가 갑자기 죽어

translation.en: leaving him, his two brothers, and three sisters without a father.
translation.ko: 그와 두 형제 및 세 누이는 아버지를 잃었습니다

translation.en: And the Roman Empire
with no designated successor to the throne.
Germanicus, Caligula's father, was very, very popular,
translation.ko: 칼리굴라의 부친 게르마니쿠스는 매우 평판 좋은 인물로

translation.en: and he's often regarded as the greatest emperor that Rome never had.
translation.ko: 로마가 갖지 못한 최고의 황제로 여겨지기도 해요

translation.en: When Caligula's father died, life became a lot less comfortable.
It doesn't take a professional psychologist to realize
quite what a damaged boy Caligula must have been.
translation.ko: 칼리굴라가 받은 상처가 얼마나 클지 알 수 있어요

translation.en: [narrator] After his sudden death,
the family of Germanicus is convinced that he was poisoned.
[Anthony Everitt] His wife, Agrippina, was enraged,
and she was convinced that the emperor had assassinated
translation.ko: 자신이 사랑하는 남편을 황제가 암살했다고 확신했고

translation.en: her much-loved husband, and she wouldn't keep quiet.
Caligula's mother was a master of mobilizing public opinion.
translation.ko: 칼리굴라의 모친은 여론 동원의 고수였어요 "코리 브레넌 럿거스대 고전학 부교수"

translation.en: [Corey Brennan] One of the things that she did was she worked Rome into hysteria
translation.ko: 여론을 이끌어 로마를 히스테리 상태로 만들었죠

translation.en: after the alleged murder of her husband, Germanicus.
And, in fact, she was viewed as very dangerous.
[narrator] With Agrippina spreading word that Germanicus has been murdered,
the people of Rome begin to turn on their emperor.
[man] I've already paid off servants in their household.
They'll testify they heard the sons commit treason. Once the Senate finds them guilty...
translation.ko: 그들이 반역을 증언하고 원로원이 유죄를 선언하면...

translation.en: We'll have them executed.
Imprisoned is what I was going to suggest.
It'll lessen suspicion, and as their uncle you'll appear merciful.
translation.ko: 그래야 의심도 가라앉고 숙부로서 자비롭게 보일 겁니다

translation.en: Shall I move forward?
Yes.
[narrator] Fearing a revolt,
Tiberius knows he has no choice
but to keep Agrippina quiet.
[Caitlin Gillespie] Tiberius felt threatened by Germanicus' family,
who was regarded as the better heirs
translation.ko: 게르마니쿠스의 가족이 즉위에 더 적통이라고 여겨졌으니까요

translation.en: to the throne than the family of Tiberius himself.
translation.ko: 즉위에 더 적통이라고 여겨졌으니까요 "케이틀린 길레스피 컬럼비아대학교 강사"

translation.en: And Agrippina gained pity over their family for his premature death.
translation.ko: 게다가 아그리피나는 남편의 이른 죽음을 앞세워 사람들의 동정을 얻어냈고요

translation.en: [Agrippina] Run! Run!
There's a third son.
Find him.
He's not here.
Where is he?
[man] Take her, too.
[narrator] Caligula's mother and older brothers are rounded up by imperial guards,
translation.ko: 근위대가 칼리굴라의 모친과 두 형을 잡아가

translation.en: and subjected to one of Tiberius' most infamous policies,
translation.ko: 티베리우스의 악명 높은 정책 중 하나인

translation.en: the treason trials.
If you had to put your finger on just one aspect of Tiberius' reign
translation.ko: 티베리우스 집권기에 그의 평판을 떨어뜨린 정책을

translation.en: which made him more unpopular than any other one,
it was the treason trials, which was anyone who criticized the emperor,
translation.ko: 반역 재판을 들 수 있어요 누구든 황제를 비판하면

translation.en: even verbal insults, not diminishing the state or treason to the state,
translation.ko: 설령 구두로라도 국가 비하나 반역이 아니어도

translation.en: but just any criticism of the emperor was punishable in a court of law.
translation.ko: 황제를 비판하는 누구나 법정에 세워 벌하는 거죠

translation.en: This is how Caligula's entire family was eliminated.
Caligula's mother was sent into exile.
His older brother was imprisoned and his other brother was executed.
All because, essentially, they are seen as potential threats to Tiberius.
translation.ko: 티베리우스에게 위협이 될 수 있다는 것만으로요 "어맨다 루게리 기자"

translation.en: [narrator] Caligula and his three younger sisters are sent to live with their grandmother,
under the close watch of Tiberius' soldiers,
never sure when the emperor will decide to eliminate them.
translation.ko: 언제 황제의 제거 명령이 떨어질지 알 수 없었죠

translation.en: It's hard to work out quite what a difficult childhood Caligula must've had.
translation.ko: 칼리굴라의 유년기가 얼마나 힘들었을지 다 가늠하기는 어려워요

translation.en: In one sense, he was a marked man at every stage.
translation.ko: 삶의 모든 면에서 요주의 인물로 찍혔으니까요

translation.en: His father was dead,
he was being kept effectively under house arrest in Rome.
translation.ko: 로마에선 꼼짝없이 집에 갇힌 신세가 됐죠

translation.en: So he will have grown up his entire life thinking,
"At midnight, there could be a knock on the door,
and someone with a knife could kill me."
[narrator] As he grows into a young man,
Caligula manages to keep his distance from Tiberius.
But an unexpected death
is about to bring him face-to-face with the emperor.
In 23 A.D.,
Drusus, Tiberius' son,
dies suddenly, at the age of 35.
Drusus was the next in line
to assume the throne.
And after Drusus' death,
Tiberius was shocked to the core.
There's not much new to report.
But there is a grumbling
about who now is to be considered the next in line.
I know this is difficult,
but it's time to start thinking about naming a new successor.
I'd be willing to step into that role if you decide it's necessary.
Let me think about it.
[narrator] While the cause of death is unclear,
there's only one man who will benefit from Drusus' demise,
translation.ko: 드루수스의 죽음으로 이득을 볼 유일한 사람은

translation.en: the head of the Praetorian Guard...
Sejanus.
[Aaron Irvin] Sejanus presented himself
as nothing more than a loyal ally and servant of Tiberius.
translation.ko: 세야누스는 티베리우스에게 충직한 조력자이자 티베리우스의 심복이었어요

translation.en: And he did so through cultivating a friendship,
translation.ko: 그와의 우정과 돈독한 관계로 그 자리에 올랐죠

translation.en: a personal relationship with Tiberius,
translation.ko: 그와의 우정과 돈독한 관계로 그 자리에 올랐죠 "에런 어빈 머리주립대 역사가"

translation.en: but he was far more ambitious than perhaps Tiberius had in mind.
translation.ko: 그러나 티베리우스의 생각보다 더 큰 야심을 품고 있었어요

translation.en: It took Tiberius completely by surprise.
He had never, it seems, expected that Sejanus would be capable
of such a betrayal.
[narrator] With his son dead,
and no one left to trust,
Tiberius begins to grow paranoid of everyone around him
translation.ko: 티베리우스는 측근에 대한 불안에 휩싸이기 시작하고

translation.en: and decides he needs to get out of Rome.
Anybody would've been paranoid in the emperor's palace at this stage.
translation.ko: 그 시기에 황궁에 있던 누구나 불안에 시달렸을 거예요

translation.en: So Tiberius puts himself into a self-imposed exile on the Island of Capri.
And he never sets foot in Rome again, for the rest of his life.
translation.ko: 죽을 때까지 로마에 다시 발을 들이지 않았어요

translation.en: [narrator] Tiberius works quickly to select a new successor.
translation.ko: 티베리우스는 재빨리 새 후계자 선정에 나섭니다

translation.en: Caligula.
Find him.
Bring him to me.
Macro.
Tell no one.
Tiberius needed an heir because the Empire needed an emperor.
translation.ko: 제국에 황제가 필요하니 티베리우스는 후계자가 필요했죠

translation.en: The Empire needed somebody at the top,
and after Drusus' death,
and the removal of the children of Germanicus apart from Caligula,
translation.ko: 게르마니쿠스의 아들은 칼리굴라 빼곤 다 제거했으니

translation.en: Caligula was the only person to fit the bill.
[narrator] Now out of Rome,
Tiberius hides out in his luxurious villa on Capri.
Located in the Tyrrhenian Sea,
Capri is over 100 miles removed from Rome,
leaving Tiberius completely isolated from the Empire he runs.
translation.ko: 이곳에서 티베리우스는 자신이 지배하는 제국에서 자신을 완전히 고립시킵니다

translation.en: [Barry Strauss] Tiberius lived in a villa modestly called the Villa Jovis,
translation.ko: 티베리우스는 '빌라 요비스'라고 소박히 명명한 별장에서 살았는데

translation.en: "the Villa of Jupiter,"
as if Tiberius was some sort of god.
This villa is perched at the edge of a cliff at one end of the island,
translation.ko: 별장은 섬 한쪽 끝의 절벽 끝머리에 위치해

translation.en: it's a very beautiful and dramatic spot.
And Tiberius engaged in a life of great decadence.
[narrator] Once settled in Capri,
Tiberius has full control over who may enter the island,
translation.ko: 티베리우스는 섬에 들일 자를 전면적으로 통제합니다

translation.en: and spends the next few years
taking advantage of his newfound privacy,
by indulging in an excessive lifestyle.
The decadence was quite spectacular on Capri.
There was the finest food, there was the finest wines,
there were the most beautiful prostitutes.
translation.ko: 최고로 아름다운 매춘부가 그 섬에 득실댔죠

translation.en: It was a very open and free lifestyle,
translation.ko: 적나라하고 자유로운 삶이었지만 "에이드리언 머독 왕립역사학회 회원"

translation.en: but it became quite debauched, on every possible level.
translation.ko: 모든 방면에서 그 정도가 지나치기 시작했어요

translation.en: The stories that we hear coming out of Capri are very much a reflection
of how much the Roman people disliked Tiberius.
translation.ko: 티베리우스를 탐탁지 않게 여겼는지 알 수 있어요

translation.en: In these stories, he is presented as weird and bizarre.
translation.ko: 그 이야기들에서 티베리우스는 별나고 괴이한 사람으로

translation.en: He watches people have sex around him in various and sundry ways.
translation.ko: 난잡한 성교를 하는 사람들에 둘러싸여 그걸 지켜봤다죠

translation.en: For a 12-year period,
Caligula's life was filled with watching his closest family members become exiled
translation.ko: 칼리굴라는 직계 가족이 황제에 반하는 말을 했다고 추방당하고 처형되는 걸 보면서 자랐어요

translation.en: and killed for speaking out against Tiberius.
So in 31 A.D. when Caligula was called to the Island of Capri,
we can only imagine the fear,
the apprehension that he must have felt at that time.
translation.ko: 그 공포감과 불안감이 얼마나 심했을지 정말 상상도 안 되죠

translation.en: [guard] This is the son of Germanicus.
Is that true?
Yes.
You blame me for your father's death, don't you?
Your mother always did.
So you've spent your entire life believing that I was the one responsible.
translation.ko: 내가 그 책임자라고 믿으며 평생 살아왔겠구나

translation.en: I didn't kill your father.
He did.
[Tiberius] This is the man responsible for your father's murder.
The man who poisoned my son.
Sejanus thought himself worthy of the throne.
So, one by one,
he got rid of everyone who stood in his path.
I am not the man you think I am.
translation.ko: 난 네가 생각하는 그런 사람이 아니야

translation.en: See him to his room.
Certainly, that early relationship between Caligula and Tiberius
would have been fraught with suspicion, with paranoia...
Caligula, a young man,
who now has to live with the guy who has ruined his life up to that point.
translation.ko: 지금껏 자신의 삶을 망친 장본인과 같이 살아야 했죠

translation.en: [narrator] Confined to his room,
Caligula finds himself forced to stay on Capri.
translation.ko: 칼리굴라는 카프리섬에 갇힌 걸 알게 됩니다

translation.en: Now, all he can do is wait to see what Tiberius has planned for him.
translation.ko: 티베리우스의 계획이 뭔지 지켜보는 일만 남았죠

translation.en: [Adrian Murdoch] Caligula was a hostage on Capri,
and if the emperor had had any problems, he could've been got rid of.
translation.ko: 황제에게 문제라도 생기면 죽을 위기에 놓이는 거죠

translation.en: It's part of the old dictum of "Keep your friends close and your enemies closer."
translation.ko: 옛말에 친구를 가까이하되 적은 더 가까이하라고 했듯

translation.en: Tiberius could keep a close eye with him,
and would have no compunction about killing him at the slightest drop of a hat.
translation.ko: 무슨 일이 있으면 거리낌 없이 죽였을 거예요

translation.en: [narrator] With Tiberius isolated on Capri,
the Roman people are left without their leader,
causing irreversible damage to his reputation as an emperor.
translation.ko: 황제로서 티베리우스의 평판은 되돌릴 수 없이 나빠집니다

translation.en: Tiberius decided to disappear to the island of Capri
and rule from a distance.
However, his retreat to Capri was not well-received.
And then all the rumors of the strange goings on at the island
translation.ko: 거기다 섬에서 일어나는 괴이한 일에 대한 소문은

translation.en: didn't really do his reputation much credit either.
translation.ko: 그의 명성에 금만 가게 할 뿐이었어요

translation.en: Tiberius ruled in a way that he thought was what the Empire needed.
translation.ko: 티베리우스는 자기 생각에 적합한 방식으로 통치했지만

translation.en: But he didn't go out of the way to look after people.
translation.ko: 실제 시민을 돌보는 통치를 하진 않았어요

translation.en: [Adrian Murdoch] It was this common touch that Tiberius missed at every stage of his career.
